intro: Streptocarpus levis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact, evergreen perennial with a rosette of leaves. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, blue, and white, and bloom throughout the year under proper care. Streptocarpus levis prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
